name: BEST WESTERN Wilsonville Inn & Suites

reviews.text: We stayed here in July for the weekend. When we checked in we found they had overbooked their double queen rooms. The staff immediately asked us if we would mind an upgrade to 2 rooms, both king with a jacuzzi for the price of 1 room with 2 queen beds. Since it was 2 moms/2 daughters we accepted. It was nice to have them offer this BEFORE we had a hassle with them. The staff has been trained well in customer service. The 2 rooms we were given were very large and well kept. They each came with a mini fridge/freezer (yes mini freezer!), coffeemaker. The rooms were well appointed. They also serve a nice continental breakfast in the lobby each morning. For the price, the service, and accommodations, I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Wonderful Customer Service / Great Rooms
Good and Cheap
reviews.text: The Phoenix Inn in Wilsonville is a pretty good hotel outside of Portland on I-5. Overall, it was clean and cheap, and had some nice features. I would probably stay there again. The Good: -Cheap... $59 for a King Suite -Free wireless high-speed Internet access -Central location, great for Portland, Salem, wine country -Free breakfast (continental stuff plus waffles, oatmeal, hard-boiled eggs, cheese, fruit) -Quiet if you ask for a room that's not overlooking I-5 -Free local/toll-free phone calls -Large rooms with work areas and couchesDisadvantages: -12% room tax -Soap and Shampoo in a dispenser... you have to ask the front desk for all of the other stuff like lotion, shower caps, mouthwash, shoe-shine kits, etc. They're claiming this is to improve environmental friendliness, but I'm thinking it's a cost-cutting measure.

reviews.title: Great Inn-Great Staff.
reviews.text: I stayed at the Phoenix Inn in Wilsonville while travelling south from Seattle. I checked in at 2:00am and was greeted by very friendly desk clerk. The hotel was immaculate and the staff the next morning was very friendly. I'd stay there again in a heartbeat.

reviews.title: Great Customer Service
reviews.text: The care given to each little detail, makes this hotel one of the finest I have ever stayed in anywhere. The rooms are all huge and very clean. They offered a breakfast that was equal to going out.Overall we were very satisfied with our stay.

We stayed at this hotel on our way to California, and enjoyed our stay. The rooms were quiet and large, considering the rates are fairly reasonable. The hotel is also in a fairly central Wilsonville location, not far from Portland. We liked the breakfast, and the pool
reviews.title: NIce Hotel for the Price

likes.liked: — Clean, large rooms and nice continental breakfast
likes.disliked: — Although our room was quiet rooms on the other side of the building could have been noisy because the hotel is very close to the highway... but overall we had a positive experience at this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: looked nice but we didn't have time to go for a swim. The staff were friendly enough and the internet terminal/wireless internet access was very handy. All in all, I would stay at this location again if I needed a hotel in Wilsonville.
reviews.title: Awesome Property

likes.liked: — The service, the cleanliness of the property, the breakfast.
likes.disliked: — The exercise room was off the pool and it was very hot and muggy - had to cut my run short because of the heat.

reviews.text: For our $69.00 room charge ($77 after taxes) we got a large, quiet comfortable king suite, complete with microwave, fridge, a separate seating area with a couch, and a large executive desk. In the morning, the breakfast included scrambled eggs with crumbled bacon bits, cheese & salsa as condiments, waffles fresh fruit, yogurt, cottage cheese, biscuits & gravy, oatmeal, assorted cerals, and of course juice & coffee. They also had an exercise room and a pool. The property was very clean and nicely decorated. The staff was wonderfully friendly and helpful. My next night in the Portland area I stayed with family at a high priced hotel along the water front for a wedding.. I was more impressed with the Phoenix Inn than the posh national chain hotel that charged me twice as much for a room half the size. I highly recommend the Phoenix Inn and will definitely stay there anytime I return to the Portland area.
reviews.title: Customer service at it's best!!

likes.liked: — Very clean establishment and excellent staff form check in to check out!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed at The Phoenix Inn Suites just off of I-5 in Wilsonville, on march 12, 2007 . I have driven past the hotel several times on my way to Portland and decided to stop in on my way back home from Washington.
reviews.title: Awesome, Friendly Service!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The moment i walked in i was greated by a smiling face at the front desk. I didn't have a reservation and the clerk offered several room types to me. I paid $72 which i guess is the state perdium in that county. The breakfast in the morning is complimentary and is a FULL HOT BREAKFAST!
reviews.title: A nice place at a good price

likes.liked: — Good value, handy location on the way to Canada.
likes.disliked: — A bit noisy due to freeway.

description: Nestled on the banks of the Willamette River, the BEST WESTERN Wilsonville Inn & Suites is right on I-5, close to Portland and borders the Willamette Valley.A stay here puts you only minutes from the vineyards and tasting rooms of the Willamette Valley and Yamhill Valley Wine Trails!Portland, Oregon's largest city is our next-door neighbor. You'll avoid the prices and traffic of the downtown Portland hotels and still be close enough to be in the heart of the cities shopping or cultural attractions within twenty minutes!Do you mountain-bike, cycle, ski or snowboard? You're in luck! Oregon's Mt. Hood Territory abounds with recreation and is our fun-filled backyard! Need a day at the beach? The spectacular Oregon coast is a beautiful hour and a half drive away, through wine country too!You can always stay in Wilsonville to play as well. We have nearly 200 acres of parks, trails, sporting fields, amusement parks, water features and more! With free public horse-shows from May to September, free concerts in the park, festivals, and family fun around every corner, there is a lot to do and see here!
